Reviews.Title: “Good but with some glitches”
Reviews.Author: Max L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pera Palace for several days before and after the Orthodox Easter (April 15 this year), got a room on the top floor, which from otside looks like a mansard, though it does not actually feel like one when inside and even has a balcony. The room was clean and cosy, but probably would be a bit too small for 2 persons, especially the bathroom, which from the standpoint of ergonomics was rather uncomfortably designed. Another grouse is a fairly limited selection of English-language TV channels, not even the CNN. Otherwise, the hotel is quite good and very conveniently located in the heart Pera -- if one is in town to enjoy the night life, or to visit some consulates on nearby Istiklal street, the cab station is right round the corner too. If one seeks a quite locale -- then this is definitely not the first port of call.

Reviews.Title: “A 5* experience... almost”
Reviews.Author: sasicka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pera Palace during the Catholic Easter holidays. We had a very nice time in Istanbul and in the hotel despite some small hitches. First, the pluses. This historic hotel has undergone a great restoration and breathes olde worlde athmosphere and charm. Lobby is great with little nooks with seats. Tea served in the afternoon is great. The drinks are good and the bar also has this olde worlde thing. Their breakfast is really great. Rooms are decent, clean and comfy. Bathrooms are pretty with a smallish but comfy tub. The hotel has an Ok fit center and a nice hammam and relax area. They have perfect concierge people. However, the reception staff lacks behind. When I was booking, I was drawn by the picture of the deluxe (=basic) room balcony overlooking the Golden Horn. I asked for my two rooms to be on the highest floor with a balcony. I also asked to have tea and coffee facilities in the room. I informed them that these were my conditions for booking. The answer was - yes, of course, we'll do our best. Well, it seems that their best was to "accommodate" these request as available at the moment of checking-in! If I had known that, I would have booked a different hotel. So they'll promise anything when booking without regard to what is actually possible. Later I found out that the photos are actually from a suite, not from a room at all, and the big premium you're paying is for a view of a small sliver of water but mainly of a four-way motorway and a football stadium. Well, at least we were not staring into a wall for 250â‚¬... And they had the chucpe to offer me an upgrade "only" for 100â‚¬ per night, if I wanted to have the room I actually wanted to book in the first place. The other unpleasant thing was that the drains in the bathroom smelled badly. They have a separate drain for the tub and for the water that splashes out of the tub. But evidently the cleaning ladies do not pour enough water into the second one, maybe they wash the shower walls only once per stay, so every time I got into the tub / shower, there was this smell of unused drain. Of course it helped to pour some water out, but it should not be the guest doing it. The third little unpleasant surprise was the price of drinks in this place. Not quite the remortgage level, but surprisingly hefty compared to the area and Istanbul in general. Well, it didn't keep us from ordering them... Just keep these things in mind when you're booking and you won't feel such discrepancy between the price and the value as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: RAWELondon
Reviews.Content: Frankly, you can do a lot better in Istanbul for a lot less money. The recent restoration of the hotel appears to have removed much of the charm it may once have had, and the hotel chain that manages it has removed the remainder. I only stayed here because my employers had booked it. No way would I spend my own money here unless forced to. The rooms are fine, but bland. The public areas are quite dramatic, but lacking any atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “How to get ripped off by a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: I went on the web site and they quoted the price of 155 euros per night. I then made a reservation for 2 rooms at the Pera Palace by calling the hotel directly. They said over the phone i had a reservation, but i had to call 4 times before they finally sent me a confirmation in writing for 310 euros for a date 1 year after the original date. I figured the date was a typo. After staying for 4 nights, they gave me a bill for 310 euros per night...per room double the web site price. Of course they then converted the bill into lira. The conversion rate was over the market. I was ripped off for $1700+.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect ...”
Reviews.Author: TMERIC
Reviews.Content: It is located in Beyoglu area which one of the most important attractions of Istanbul. You have a chance to arrive Old Town and Golden Horn attractions in 5 min by taxi. All traditional restaurants , historical Istiklal street , Galata Tower , Taksim square are in 5 min walking distance . It is a very old hotel with very interesting stories in its history . This newly renouvated (faithfully to the original) nostalgic hotel has very premium rooms , very well trained staff and good customer services . Price is not cheap , but compared to 5 star hotels of the region it is much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place”
Reviews.Author: JasperJohnson
Reviews.Content: Just about anybody who is anybody has stayed at this hotel as this was a stop off point for the Orient Express. The comfort factor wasn't there, this is a rickety hotel with character.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with History”
Reviews.Author: balsaie
Reviews.Content: After a long restoration period the Pera Palace Hotel has been restored to its glory. The rooms are a bit on the small side (to be expected from a classical hotel), but the level of furnishing and comfort is second to non. The staff are amazing and they would go out of their way to help you. Free WiFi is a great offer, finally top hotels realize that offering such service for free is the right thing to do. I can't think of any bad or average to say about this hotel but the best. Never had the chance to try the foor other then the Breakfast which was very good a bit on the high side but you can't go wrong on food in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “All old world charm and class!”
Reviews.Author: Idenburger
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Beautifully renovated Grand Hotel with staff that you can only dream of attending to you! Fantastic public areas, wonderful rooms and very knowledgable, courteous and friendly staff! Really FIVE star!

Reviews.Title: “The grande dame of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodRob
Reviews.Content: For close proximity to the bustling nightlife of Istanbul, the Pera Palace Hotel is the ultimate in luxury and the only place to be. Few hotels can boast the range of roles in fiction than the Pera Palace, showing up as it does in Agatha Christieâ€™s Murder on the Orient Express, Ian Flemingâ€™s From Russia with Love and Alfred Hitchcockâ€™s The Lady Vanishes. As I arrived in the colonnaded marble hall, a group of greeters in crisp grey tails and black foulard pounced on me with alarming servility, purring 'Welcome to Pera Palace. Let us help you'. It was an introduction that sums up the time-honored traditions of old Istanbul, and this legendary pearl first opened in 1892 in the twilight years of the Ottoman Empire. Turkey's first Western hotel has recently undergone a four-year $30million much-needed facelift to restore it to its old school splendor and now itâ€™s a 'museum-hotel'. First opened in 1892 of the Ottoman Empire to serve European passengers of the Orient Express train, the hotel had the city's first elevator (still working) and was the first building in Istanbul, other than the Ottoman palaces, to have hot water and electricity. Eminent guests included Greta Garbo, Mata Hari, King Edward VIII, Queen Elizabeth II, Emperor Franz Joseph, Zsa Zsa Gabor, Sarah Bernhardt, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Alfred Hitchcock and Ernest Hemingway. It was not by chance that it attracted Agatha Christie, who is said to have written some of Murder on the Orient Express in Room 411, although in the novel she has Hercule Poirot check into the now demolished Hotel Tokatlian once located nearby. The soaring lobby leads to the majestic, domed Kubbeli Saloon and Tea Lounge with its soaring domed ceiling and bold striped walls and 'Arabian Nights' ambience; the Orient Bar and the Patisserie de Pera have a nostalgic charm. A new basement level features a spa and Turkish bath, as well as the refined Agatha restaurant (named after Agatha Christie, the hotel's most famous guest), run by the buoyant chef Maximilian JW Thomae, who fashioned the menu to reflect the notable stops on the Orient-Express: Paris, Venice and Istanbul by mixing French, Italian and Turkish delights including a heavenly chilled artichoke soup with quail kebab served on a steaming bed of Asian risotto. Also, I had one of the best breakfasts of my life at the hidden away Patisserie de Pera, a charming in-house patisserie which serves French pastries, macaroons, amazing healthy omelets and pots of strong, steaming coffee in grand hotel style. a delightfully nostalgic setting for breakfast, The restoration have preserved the hotel's orientalist dÃ©cor, strongly evocative of fin-de-siÃ¨cle Constantinople, faithful to the original designs and color schemes in the public spaces, but the 115 rooms have been completely reconstructed to make them uber comfy including all the latest tech gadgets. Donâ€™t worry, they still highlight original nineteenth-century features like white Carrara marble and gorgeous Murano glass chandeliers My room boasts a comfy French balcony with stunning views from Galata to the Golden Horn, from the slopes of Eyup to Tepebasi. Inside, antique paintings, classic furniture and rich fabrics convey an aura of fascination and elegance. Also with Golden Horn views are the two Presidential Suites. Liberally sized at 115 square meters, and located on the fourth and fifth floors of the hotel, the living areas include dining room, living room and study, as well as a huge dressing room which would make the Housewives of Beverly Hills jealous and separate guest bathrooms. Nothing beats the jetlag of a long transatlantic trip like a scintillating spa treatment and the Peraâ€™s 380-square-meter spa facilities (managed by Spa Soul in cooperation with world famous Swiss Spa brand After the Rain,) offers an indoor jet stream swimming pool, steam bath, Jacuzzi, sauna and a fully equipped gym, and a traditional Turkish hammam. Treatments are named after celebrity guests like Greta Garbo, the Divine or Hemingwayâ€™s Choice treatment for men. If first impressions are anything to go by, grande dame of Istanbul definitely captures the bygone glamour days of the Ottoman Empire. Itâ€™s a definitely cherished gem.

Reviews.Title: “Stopped in for a drink”
Reviews.Author: mandy939
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend popping in, just to see the historic elevator, and have a (rather expensive but well worth it) drink in the bar, as Agatha Christie, Mata Hari, and Hemmingway did. Take a look upstairs and see where Agatha Christie wrote Murder on the Orient Express (room 411)........it is in the book "1,000 Places to See Before You Die" afterall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice front office staff but careful with back office”
Reviews.Author: General S
Reviews.Content: We held a conference just after this hotel reopened and the staff, since left I understand, were as helpful as possible. The rooms, whilst small, were well done though I doubt they will hold up to hard use as time goes by. It was a good conference and the customer facing staff were great. The hotel admin however was appalling, unable to determine who had booked in our group, they couldn't reconcile room nights( stay lengths) with number of rooms and then tried to claim beyond the agreement. Be very careful indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem hidden in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stargazer43
Reviews.Content: When one searches for a hotel in Istanbul this is not one that normally appears. I found it through a friend's recommendation. It is an old hotel - one of the oldest in Istanbul - where the earliest Orient Express passengers were taken in sedan chairs from the train station when they arrived. It is situated on an elevated part of the city and one side of the hotel has views of the city and sea. Not far from a major pedestrianised shopping area with multiple taxis available close by. From the moment you arrive one notices the genuine friendly and hospitable attitude to guests. Turks are naturally friendly, proud of their identity and welcome you to their country. The hotel is immaculately clean and well maintained - in the old fashioned style. They even have a working elevator from 1892 - the first in Istanbul. Yes, they also have modern elevators. You can feel the history of this hotel where famous people have stayed. The public rooms are beautiful with impeccable service. Their food is excellent if you want to dine in and there is a swimming pool and gymnasium if you want to work off the calories. Everything is beautifully presented and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Service with a capital S. Ask for a room - if possible, with views and imagine yourself whisked back in time to the 1920's. The downside? Only one that I noticed. The walls of the rooms are paper thin and so one can hear everything from the adjoining room. Conversations, footsteps - everything. Not a problem if the adjoining room is empty but a major turn off if you are trying to sleep and the person next door is operating on a different time zone! Otherwise a great place to stay and sally forth to explore an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to recommend but....”
Reviews.Author: dsgusa
Reviews.Content: The Pera Palace was recently renovated but they seem to have forgotten a few rooms, specifically, the bathrooms in a few rooms. Yes our room was miniscule, yes, apparently since we didn't book directly, our room was not the most expensive, but did we have to have a bathtub, placed a foot or so from the wall, no shower curtain, that leaked onto the entire slippery bathroom floor? Apparently so. We were told there were no more rooms and we'd have to pay more if we wanted to move to a room with a functioning bath. So while the lobby was fine, the breakfast was fine, the concierge was helpful, there is no way we can recommend this hotel given our room during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice!”
Reviews.Author: windowseat
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel beginning of december.Since the prices are above our regular budget we had to go with the standard/pera view room.In our case a room on the second floor facing the street behind the hotel.You could still see the place in front of the hotel.We didnt mind that at all.One should be aware that the rooms with view are facing a busy fast traffic local expressway kind of thing.We had a little balcony and made the most out of that.The room itself was very tastefully decorated,the brand new furniture had an antique look,but in a good way.There is a window between bathroom and sleeping area,which means you should be very confidant or a happy couple if you are not travelling solo.All the lovely little touches like the weatherforecast on the pillow etc,things which are so easy and leave a happy guest.Our rate didnt include breakfast,but there are lots of cafes around,we had our breakfast at the restaurant on top of the galata tower,which must be the best view of Istanbul.The staff at check in was very helpfull,friendly and professional.Hotel in walking distance of Beyoglu.You have the history of this hotel and yes, the elevator,which is part of the gimmick.I was quite done with the Agatha Christy thing after two nights,could be probably really diffcult if you stay for more nights or trying to get business done i would imagine.There is also a TV channel dedicated just to the very moving history of the Palace Hotel....may be i just saw it in a endless loop falling asleep i am just thinking.Anyway,this a an amazing place.The (hotel)world would be a better place with more hotels like this.We will come back exactly to this one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere and super service.”
Reviews.Author: Zanziluel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Pera Palace for a weekend in aoctober 2011 and got a lovely Greta Garbo room on the corner with balcony. Large room and very nice bathroom with tub and extras that are valuable for a woman on a business trip. Breakfast was great and included bacon that I never got in Turkey before. Try the pool and haman inhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Gem”
Reviews.Author: Chris1420
Reviews.Content: Wonderful ambiance after this thoughtful renovation, especially in the public areas. Rooms are very nice - not huge, but well appointed with lovely bathrooms.Great location for experiencing the real Istanbul, with lots of local shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. Tiny pool and spa downstairs but again, nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Pera Palace”
Reviews.Author: dogwalker2011
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Istanbul and stayed for three nights at this hotel. I must say it exceeded my expectations. The staff in the reception area and on the door were courteous, helpful and charming and certainly the best dressed I've seen in a few years. My room was smallish but very comfortable and everything I could want in a hotel room was laid on. It didn't have a feeling of being in a city centre as my room was very quiet in the evening. I did use the spa and must say that I had one of the best massages ever. The hotel reception rooms are beautiful and I ate in the restaurant twice. The food was delicious. I travel a lot in my business and would definitely return to the Pera Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: 885jilly157
Reviews.Content: We read lots of reviews of this hotel, and frankly some are not very fair, this hotel is beautufully renovated , expertly staffed and retains most of its historic flavour, it is a city hotel and in a city of 17 million people there is bound to be some noise intrusion, we found only one night of our 4 night stay noisy because of celebrating residents after a basket ball match. The price of drinks is high and we didnt eat in the restaurant but, if you need a calm relaxing place of refuge whilst exploring the undoubted delights of Istanbul then this is a good choice. it really doesnt matter that Agatha Christie stayed here once, its the quality of the bathrooms, the towels and the bathrobes, the instant service and the friendly reception which is important. For our American cousins there is more than one lift and they have retained the old original lift which supports some spectacular iron work. WE admit our viit was off season but nevertheless you can tell a well run hotel from the moment you walk thro to reception.

Reviews.Title: “character and spirit of accomodation floors sadly lost”
Reviews.Author: more-me-me
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the loss of spirit here, resulting from the recent uber-restoration. Although the foyer and Kubbeli Salon areas were still elegant, the upper floors with the bedrooms and the interiors of the rooms themselves (I saw 3) were much like any 5 star hotel chain anywhere else in the world. Dotted about the shiny corridors (with ubiquitous business-hotel-style-carpets and super-shiny new looking marble floors) are glass-covered museum cases containing original cutlery/menus etc. Even the Agatha Christie room has been treated this way, with her old typewriter perched as an 'exhibit' in an otherwise off-the-peg 5 star hotel room. This nod to the history/spirit of the place didn't do it for me. So sad to see another important Grande Dame lost this way.

Reviews.Title: “History restored perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Tambo_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night unfortunately as the hotel has been restored to a very high standard. The room was very good but the bed was probably the most comfortable we have slept in in any hotel anywhere! We also found the reception staff impeccable. We are walkers and found the hotel was surprisingly well located with easy access to the Istiklal Pedestrian Mall and even the Galeta bridge via the funicular.

Reviews.Title: “TRuly historical”
Reviews.Author: ShabbirMerchant
Reviews.Content: This hotel oozes with history and nostalgia. Very well located to attractions, rooms are well appointed and give you a good late 19 th century feel. The banquet hall is really well done and dont miss looking up at the ceiling. The 19 th century elevator still works and you get a ride when you check in. Breakfast spread is excellent, so s the buffet lunch. Service levels are a little slow

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mb4ever
Reviews.Content: historic hotel right in the middle of the city with great staff and a fantastic old world charm. Loved the tea service there. I stayed in the greta garbo room and I must say that is the best room I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The Pera in Passing”
Reviews.Author: MrFredBahrain
Reviews.Content: Let me say at the outset, we didn't - unfortunately - stay at the magnificently refurbished Pera Palace hotel, with its charming and discreet staff, but we did have a good 'look around' and had a superb coffee and French pastry in the charming French patisserie! The whole place is a must for nostalgia buffs, the fabled end point of the fabled Orient Express, and all done up so that if Ataturk, Garbo, Agatha Christie, Hemingway and a whole host of A-listers of yesterday walked by, you wouldn't bat an eyelid, because they so obviously belong! Why, you might even spy Mata Hari taking the much loved 'afternoon tea'. Stay there if you can afford it, or just wallow in the ambience, as we did by taking a 'yesteryear cup' and drinking in our fill of a wonderful, historically resplete old dame. A steal at 75 Turkish lira for coffee, cakes and memories!

Reviews.Title: “History at a Price”
Reviews.Author: Lorne1000
Reviews.Content: Tastefully refurbished Hotel that has retained much of its old world charm including its original lift, even if you only allowed to us it on arrival. Staff were numerous and extremely helpful. The room we had which was sold on the basis of a view of the Golden Horn was a generous size, comfortable and well quipped and provided a glimpse of the Golden Horn. The Hotel is some distance from many of the cities major sights and on one side the area is less desirable and dominated by hardware and electrical trades while on the other(higher) sides there is much to see and wander through. Pricing is presumably based on the hotels history and as a consequence is somewhat exorbitant. Why do they have their X-ray machine operating all the time at the front when no ones takes any notice of it but it zaps you every time you leave or arrive?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellinghawk777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a definite must in Istanbul, if you're not on a budget. Recently reopened after major refurbish, it is the hotel where travellers on the Orient Express used to lodge in in the late 19th and early 20th century. It has welcomed Agatha Christie, Greta Garbo and Ataturk himself, the founder of the modern Turkish republic. The inner lobby (tea room) is amazing, the Orient Bar is full of atmosphere. This is a top-notch hotel with superb amenities, a fantastic breakfast buffet and a high-end spa (great place to have a hammam - Turkish bath). Service is top-notch. Located in the heart of the Pera district, near the Galata tower and lots of excellent restaurants (Mezze across the street, Yakup2 a little further, etc.). There are 2 modern elevators (1-6 and 1-4 floors), and a wonderful staircase with a circa 1900 elevator (need a staff to ride). The concierge and reception all speak good English and are helpful and very friendly. If I can still afford it, I will definitely stay there again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “All I had hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: Jakartarobert
Reviews.Content: I had been recommended to stay at the Pera Palace by good friends who had stayed prior to the renovations . .... I was not disappointed . The price was a bit above my budget for my gelidly but I did want the last few days of my holiday to be special ..again I was not disappointed .... Good value at the price , for all it offers ... Wonderfully renovated including all the modern amenities but maintaining the old world charm . The rooms are so comfortable and the beds just super . For staying in this part of town , the location is excellent . Conceirge and door staff are very helpful and polite as are all the staff in all areas . Do try the breakfast in the Agatha Restruant and oh a cocktail in the Orient Bar before dinner ... The dry martini was superb ..... I will certainly return .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lizz b
Reviews.Content: Ä± feel myself very lucky to stay in this beautiful hotel, we had a hesitate before we book but our stay in pera palace was wonderful. hotel located in the city center and 15 minutes drive distance to all historical sights. we had a very nice golden horn view room. breakfast in agatha restaurant has a very rich open buffet i have ever seen.ladies at the reception were very helful and concierge team made our stay one of the most memorible with their recommendations. thank you pera palace, we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Robituzin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pera Palace for 8 nights during the last week of September and we booked one of the signature rooms. It is true that the hotel has a long history and the remodeling brought it up to high standards of comfort and it is true that is the only Istanbul hotel mentioned in the book "1000 Places to see before you die", but they have a fundamental problem with personnel. Do not ask questions to the Concierge, twice we did and the answers were wrong or misleading; ordered eggs at the breakfast buffet and they were never brought, ordered tea, same thing (we had breakfast included in our rate, so we eat there every day). Every time you talk to someone, their answers were unreliable. The list goes on and on and on. The service the hotel personnel provides does not go along with the 400, to 600 euros per night price tag. Visit the place and have a cup of tea instead if you need to see how the Orient Express travelers ended their trips during the Ottoman Empire. The building only has one elevator (max 6 persons) servicing floors 1-6. at certain times, it was very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Like Re-living History - Sept 7-9”
Reviews.Author: Orient_Ex_Travel
Reviews.Content: We had booked a trip from Istanbul to Venice on the Orient Express, so we decided to stay in the Pera Palace which have so many historical connections with the Orient Express. The service was excellent and the staff friendly & very helpful. The rooms had been updated and were extremely comfortable. We ate at the Terrace Restaurant as well as Agatha Restuarant...the service & food were delicious. The Orient Express and Agatha Christie memoribilia on each floor was exciting. Staying in the Pera Palace to begin our Orient Express journey was the very best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from 5 Star Level”
Reviews.Author: but_Nutella
Reviews.Content: I was there for a 5 days and I never wanna go back to it again. facte in a nutshell unfriendly. noisy. no electrity for one whole evening and night. one day fot the whole morning cold water in the bathroom, no professional staff, only one lift.. for more than 100 rooms. cause the antic lift you cannot use alone and the second one is only for brining you to public areas not to the rooms. It started with a very unfriedly guest realtionship manager, obviously she doesn't know what such a job needs for qualifications. Very unhelpful, undfriendly and stuck up she showed me my room and was no big help in case to question about landmarks and restaurant suggestion. Second night i just was taking a shower all of the sudden, there was no electrity after one our of waiting in the dark, an a lot of fake explanations trhough the managment team i dressed up for dinner in the dark. 3 Hours later I came back to the hotel, there was still no electrity. Finally after long discussions, i was allowed to change to a room on a lower level which hat electrity but was even more noisy because it was located straight to one mainstreet. The last day, i wanted to take a shower in the morning, but there was no warm water in the whole hotel... this all sucks. it sucks even morge the the everage rate i pad was round about 300â‚¬Â a night. pera palace never again for me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent!”
Reviews.Author: august25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Pera Palace, staying in the Pierre Lotti suite. Overall, the suite itself is beautiful, and extremely comfortable with all modern amenities. i would stay here again in a flash. Downsides: tiny bathtub, shower cubicle not properly sealed so water got all over the place. TV in the bedroom placed in a way that a DVD player couldn't be attached - wouldn't normally have been a problem, but I was 7 months pregnant at the time and needed to rest quite a bit and could have used the entertainment! The combination lock on my suitcase refused to open, a problem which was speedily sorted out by housekeeping (broke the lock) . Breakfast at Agatha was yummy and staff very friendly. Had a meal there once as well, was outstanding . Try the gaufrette ! The pool and spa area is poor- people kept coming and talking to the masseuse while my husband was having a massage. Overall, we had a fab time- would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reactions”
Reviews.Author: Kai-Ala
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Pera Palas Hotel both before and after its 2010 renovation, my opinion is that while the quality of the lodging aspect of the product has been brought to a rather high modern standard, much of the old establishmentâ€™s nostalgic charm has been corralled into a few display cases containing historic documents of indifferent interest. Thankfully, the original elevator has been preserved, as has the dÃ©cor of the Kubbeli Saloon, and the Ataturk museum room (open to the public by appointment) remains as it was during our original visit years ago. The renovation of the Orient Bar had not yet been completed during our late July, 2011 visit. The rooms and suites have been fully modernized and are spacious and well furnished, though without much ambience that would invoke the hotelâ€™s Ottoman history. My overall rating for this property would be above average if this were the only factor considered. The hotelâ€™s implementation of a modern, customer-oriented service component has been less successful than the physical renovation. Individual staff members were, with a few exceptions, extremely pleasant and eager to oblige, when able to do so. For example, the concierge desk, having recommended a restaurant a few blocks away, sent along one of the young bellmen to walk with us through the areaâ€™s confusing maze of streets. That was nicely done. On the other hand, the concierge desk, when asked for restaurant recommendations, pushed several that have been identified in other reviews as â€œconcierge favoritesâ€� at several of the big hotels, and which offered indifferent food at exorbitant prices. Yet they did not mention a very fine restaurant just ten steps away. (We found it ourselves on Tripadvisor!). Unfortunately, the front desk did not measure up to what should be expected in a first-class establishment. Interactions ranged from cold to hostile. Our rooms werenâ€™t ready at checkin and we were upsold to what they called suites, though one of the two rooms certainly was not a suite. We were cheerily informed by one staff member that our room rate included breakfast, but after being presented with a bill at breakfast the next day we inquired at the front desk and were told no, the room did not include breakfast. When I said that we had been told it did by the staff member (who was then standing right next to the receptionist) the reply was â€œshe made a mistake.â€� The breakfast charge was there at checkout, itself a very confused process entailing three separate credit card charges. Overall, the front desk operation was not customer-friendly, and was a weak point. I canâ€™t recommend this hotel for a tourist visitor. The areas worth seeing are open to the public, and in summer a walk through the lobby and Kubbeli Saloon, followed by a cool drink on the outdoor terrace, might be worthwhile. A visit to Ataturk's room offers a rare chance to glimpse the private life of one of the 20th Century's greatest political figures. For a business visit on an expense account, it would be a good choice if the business to be done is in the vicinity. Otherwise, this marvelous city offers many more attractive alternatives for tourist lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine establishment”
Reviews.Author: ThegilaniAK
Reviews.Content: The prestigious Pera Palac is thenplace where upper class travellers on the Orient Express called home while in Istanbul. I feel I was luvkey to have stayed here. Although my room did not have an excellent view, it over looked a street connecting the hotel location to the famouse Istiklal St. The bed was extra comfy. The pillow cases and the bath robe I had to buy :o) the breakfast foresd and what's cooked to order is as great as kings would love to have. The staff here mostlly speaks great English. It feels that the staff to guests ratio is excellent. You can get help and be served whereever you looked. The staff members at the door will remember you from the first time you walked in by name, which is a wonderful touch that shows how much they care about your comfort. The spa and Turkish bath area is very exquisite, not to mention the bath and massages, which are givin by well trained caring staff members. I have to say that although the hotel was originally established in 1892, it was reopenned in 2010. So it was furnished with the latest in technology and comfort. The curtins and blackout are electriclly closed, free wifi, payperbiew flat screen tv, excellent bath room, elevatorsâ€¦ will definitlly visit again. Maybe honeymoon there :o)

Reviews.Title: “Like being on the Orient Express”
Reviews.Author: Francesco F
Reviews.Content: We were a bit uncertain before confirming our booking at Pera Palace, as we knew it had gone through a long refurbishment and we were worried it had happened something like at The Savoy in London. Instead everything was perfect! From the check in, when they make you use the oldest lift in Europe, all wooden made, to the very simple but perfect service you get through your stay. The service and the staff are not pretentious. You don't need to show off. You just deserve the best, and Pera Palce is the best in Istanbul! Concierge is very helpful and professional in assisting you with restaurants, and Hamans. Use the swimming pool and turkish bath in the basement. People sometimes are scared about the costs involved, but it's free! Wi-Fi is free as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Great service. Amazing spa.”
Reviews.Author: IsraelTroy
Reviews.Content: I tend to write very critical reviews, so this is my first ever raving review on trip advisor. In fact, i came to Istanbul from New York, where I spent a week at the great Trump Soho Hotel, and the Pera Palace almost put it to shame. We reserved a long romantic weekend directly from the hotel, by phone, and thus recieved the weekend rate, plus free breakfast. They were even willing to offer the price for the 4th night, that wasn't a weekend. Check one. As we arrived to the beautiful building, we were offered to upgrade for 40 euro/night. Since we were't sure they showed us both. We grabbed the 6th floor upgtrade with a balcony and view without hesitation. Check two. You never know what you get for an included breakfast deal. Some paces it's meager. At the Pera Palace it was worthy of kings. A first rate spread buffett, plus Eggs of choice. They were happy to prepare for us round after round of Turkish coffee. Check three. Sadly we didn't try the spa until our third day. Or was that bad? We might never have gone out to see the city;) The basic use of the first rate small pool, gym, and three glorious steam rooms--with robes etc.--is free. Check four. Above all there was the impecable service, from doormen to the cleaning staff. When we had an electricity problem is was fixed in 5 minutes. Thogether with the great location, minibar, bed, and ancient old world charm, well it's check check check to a full 10. Thank you for a memorable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Always Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Lightsentence
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Pera Palace around once a month for business and for anywhere from two to eight days at a time. Every time I come, the staff has been nothing short of amazing - they are attentive, very quick with requests and even helped me to locate a phone that I left at a restaurant miles away. For my business needs, printed materials are delivered to my door in record time and besides working at the desk in my room, I find it rather relaxing to spread out in the downstairs bar in the corner. The hotel is spectacularly clean and well maintained, the food is delicious and every time I arrive, I notice something new they are doing to further improve the hotel - a selection of loukums in your room upon arrival, fresh flowers, quicker ways to check in - they honestly care about their guests. The hotel shampoo and conditioner are better than what I bring from home and the also supply rooms with bathtubs with bath salts, bubble bath and a loofa. I cannot say enough about this hotel. The only drawback of the place is its proximity to a very busy and noisy road, though the noise is only perceptible if you open the window.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel trying to be first class”
Reviews.Author: lulu072
Reviews.Content: The renovated Pera Palace opened less than a year ago and is still a work in progress...the help is trying hard and some are very good, but the check out took a painfully long time, and when i tried to get a complimentary tea with my wake-up call, I was told that the only complimentary beverage was coffee....strange and inconvenient for us tea drinkers..... The rooms however are lovely and Istanbul itself is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dollyQld
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience,very special,try it. Brims with atmosphere and charm,staff are excellent,rooms beautiful,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: Ruby06London
Reviews.Content: My family and I had afternoon tea here a few days ago. It was a fantastic experience and one that I would recommend. The hotel has been beautifully renovated and we were lucky enough to be given a tour of this stunning building. It was so interesting to see the items that they have kept from the famous visitors that have graced the hotel over the years. The cakes at the afternnon tea were delicious. They were presented as a buffet so you could choose whichever ones you like and return again and again! I have been to Istanbul many times and didn't realise what a wonderful experience visiting this hotel would be until a few days ago. If you are planning a trip to this fantastic city make sure you visit this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wildmandxb
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a nice stay in Istanbul. The whole staff are welcoming, the check in was done very quickly, we were escorted to our room upon our arrival and shown every detail we needed to know. This hotel as others have mentioned has a very special charm to it, as it is old and stylish at the same time. Everyone in Istanbul knows this hotel. It is a couple of blocks away from istiklal street, one of the main attractions of the city. In order to give other future travellers to IStanbul some hints, during the mornings it is wise to go see the Blue Mosque, Aya sofia, topkapi palace and other landmarks of istabul. They are all located in on area and very easy to travel between the attractions on foot. Spend the day in Sultanahmet area as there is a lot going on there. however, there is nothing in that area at night, hence istiklal road becomes the main attraction with all the bars and cafes that it offers. Ofcourse there are many many other things to do at night in this HUGE city, so if anyone needs any advise i will be more than glad to help. just drop me a message in my inbox. Kaan from the Concierge is the most amazing guy we met in Turkey. he was very helpful, made some wonderful restaurant recommendations, and i highly recommend the Istanbul Balik restaurant under the Galat bridge for the best SeaBass ever! However, excpect to pay exceptional amounts for this! Word of advise though! Turkish people are very nice in general, they would love to help although there is this language barrier that might be a bit of a hassle. They love their culture and language that's why they stick to it and i personally like that about them. However, please watch out for the cab drivers!!! These are the slickest, most sly living things on earth! They will do ANYTHING to get the max out of your pocket. DO NOT go for the meter if you are travelling in a cab for a short distance! We had to take a cab once for a 10min drive that usually costs less than 10TL bacause it was raining. Upon our arrival to our destination, the meter MAGICALLY showed a horrendous figure 43TL!!! Although i was screening the meter every couple of seconds. I tried telling the driver nicely that i will not be paying that amount since i knew it was not correct. He tried convincing me that this is the meter and he can't do anything about it. I told him i don't care what is going to happen, i am not paying even if we had to have an arguement infront of everyone in the streets of Istanbul. I stopped one of the passersby and asked him for the number of the police. He offered nicely to interfer and talk to the cab driver, who finally surrendered and said only this time he will accept half the money since we are tourists! inorder to cut it short, agree witht he cab driver the fee BEFORE you get in, make sure you ask your hotel how much it will cost! Anyways, don't let this issue keep you from travelling to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointement about the renovation”
Reviews.Author: aleksi1
Reviews.Content: Pera Palace is a legendary hotel which had been used by politicians, writers, movie stars etc..... It became shabby and I expected much of the renovation, expecting to find again that special atmosphere of a palace hotel of the end of the XIX Century. With the exception of the central lounge, the rest of the hotel and particularely the bar, the dining room and the bed room have been re-decorated in a way that cannot be criticised (clean, modern, no "faute de goÃ»t") except that it is cold, impersonal, with no atmosphere: you could be anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Love this classic old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbyroni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was renovated last year and was done in a very classic, tasteful style. Staff was extremely helpful. Rooms are decent size with a marble bathroom with a tub and shower and a heated floor.

Reviews.Title: “Magic and Mystery, History and Luxury, where East meets West”
Reviews.Author: DominiqueBelgium
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a truly unique city, worth discovering but avoid the hot summer. We went there early February and decided to spent some extra money for a comfortable Hotel: Pera Palace in the old European district. This recently refurbished 5-star hotel was booked shortly before leaving via Internet for 4 nights. At arrival and when the bell boy kindly let us in, we immediately stared at the ceiling and the exceptional beauty of this palace. Is this a Hotel, or is it a museum? It is both! Book in Pera Palace and discover history with a mysterious room devoted to Mustafa Kemal AtatÃ¼rk, the father of the Turkish republic. Or stroll through the hotel to find the room where Agatha Christie stayed. Enough of history? Than turn to luxury, with a very nice Spa/swimming poll, a fine restaurant, exceptional staff and top quality bedding. All this in a perfect location, easily accessible and nearby tourist attractions and public transport. Start packing now!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: salsaviajera
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pera Palace hotel for 8 nights as a business traveler who also had a weekend for sightseeing and shopping. The hotel has been beautifully renovated to its former glory and is just exquisite. The bed was super comfy, the room was quiet and tastefully decorated, the shower with its grey marble was elegant, and even the city view (not the gorgeous view of the Bosporus of the more expensive rooms) was enjoyable. It was too cold to sit on the little balcony, but it would be enjoyable in the spring or fall. The service was top-notch and very friendly and helpful. As a female traveling alone, I felt perfectly safe, well taken care of and at home in the hotel. The location of the hotel in the Istiklal neighborhood means that there are plenty of small and reasonably priced restaurants and shops within a block or two, with plenty of great walking and shopping. I highly recommend this hotel to all travelers. You're only a 6-10 Lira taxi ride from the Grand Bazaar or Agya Sofia complexes, so it's quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “good trip”
Reviews.Author: otelcomchristmas
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting in Turkey. I needed a hotel and made a searc on the net. I found Pera through dhr.com as the most apropriate one for me. The web page led me have a nice stay as the hotel did itsel.

Reviews.Title: “Back in the Future”
Reviews.Author: nikos1894
Reviews.Content: Historical hotel,with real taste of Istanbul.The location is not in the today's life.Very helpfull people,moderate breakfast,fantastic bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Sultans”
Reviews.Author: enriqueycarmen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the experience at your hotel. All staff were very polite, from the PR lady who welcomed us until the Asst. Executive Chef whom we met at the Agatha Restaurant on Sunday morning. We loved the bed, the dÃ©cor and furniture, and the beautiful bath. The spa was great and the breakfast, delicious. We will not only recommend it but also â€“Ä°nÅŸallah- come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pera Palace is back”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: Following the reopening, the Turkish spelling of the hotel is gone; it is now called the Pera Palace. Maybe Tripadvisor should open a new page with the reviews since the reopening last month. The hotel has been very well renovated, especially the public rooms: reception, Patisserie de Pera, hall, Orient Bar. The rooms are essentially new, but they combine a 1900-style decoration (including many antiques) with modern comfort. Great bathroom (with one small design fault: no hook for the bathrobe). The food is excellent, and I liked the combination of French and Turkish cuisine at Agatha. The breakfast buffet is the best I have had in Turkey (favourites: the smoked trout and the Swiss-style roesti with herbs). There is a new fitness and spa, with a complete sauna (steam room, dry sauna, ice fountain, etc.) and a pool (a little small) + jacuzzi. The standards of housekeeping are high, but the service is inconsistent. Overall, the staff seemed to lack the experience of working with foreign guests at a 5-star hotel. This was especially true for the concierge and many of the waiters, especially at the Orient Bar (but also at the main restaurant, except for the maitre d'hotel). Other than that, it was a pleasure to be at the renovated Pera Palace, which I remembered as a faded grande dame in the 1980s.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: emekli
Reviews.Content: I think you should take this hotel off your list of available hotels;since it is and will be closed thru 2010 due to renovations, resulting from transfer of ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when my husband had to do a presentation in Istanbul. We had a lovely big room with a great view over the Bosporus. The hotel bar is expensive but it is very nice.. We only had breakfast and went out in the evening to some local restaurants, some of which can be reached on foot. We can really recommend the Turkish bath in the city center, taxi is cheap and the experience is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel full of character, in best part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ucube
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Pera Palas. Had a huge room with views, was once quite opulent, but now faded (as is the whole hotel) but still was amazing charm and beauty. Got a great deal on the room, by booking directly with hotel - and thought it was absolutely worth the price (we stayed a WEEK there!) Location is actually fantastic, you are right in the hippest part of Istanbul with tons of cafes, restaurants, bars, and shopping withing a five minute walk (plus one of the most architecturally distinctive parts of the city). Great neighborhoods all around it, and it is (thankfully) AWAY from the tourist hustling of SultanAhmet - we found that to be extremely tiresome to be constantly harrased by touts in Sultanahmet. Taxis are $4 to get to Sultanamhet during the day, and at night, you are already in the heart of things. Can't recommend it enough - thought it really made our stay in Istanbul fabulous. Oh, we first booked three nights via the hotel website (cuz we were not sure we would want to stay there the whole time), and then we went to the front desk and got an even better rate for the last 4 nites - something to think about. If you're looking for more upscale rooms/environmen, the Marmara is right across the street (great bar, great views) - but is three times the price (but also has a rooftop pool that we were dying to go into!). From the elevator, to the lobby boys, to the large room, to the cool neighborhood, we loved it.
